questions.question_text:
CNG is an important transportation fuel. When 100 g CNG is mixed with 208 g oxygen in vehicles, it leads to the formation of CO2 and H2O and produces large quantity of heat during this combustion, then the amount of carbon dioxide, produced in grams is ____________. [nearest integer]

[Assume CNG to be methane]
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
CNG is an important transportation fuel. When 100 g CNG is mixed with 208 g oxygen in vehicles, it leads to the formation of CO_{2} and H_{2}O and produces large quantity of heat during this combustion, then the amount of carbon dioxide, produced in grams is ____________. [nearest integer] 
[Assume CNG to be methane]

questions.question_text:
A fish swimming in water body when taken out from the water body is covered with a film of water of weight 36 g. When it is subjected to cooking at 100$$^\circ$$C, then the internal energy for vaporization in kJ mol$$-$$1 is ___________. [nearest integer]

[Assume steam to be an ideal gas. Given $$\Delta$$vapH$$^\Theta $$ for water at 373 K and 1 bar is 41.1 kJ mol$$-$$1 ; R = 8.31 J K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1]
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:

[Assume steam to be an ideal gas. Given $$\Delta$$_{vap}H$$^\Theta $$ for water at 373 K and 1 bar is 41.1 kJ mol^{$$-$$1} ; R = 8.31 J K^{$$-$$1} mol^{$$-$$1}]

questions.question_text:
Cu(s) + Sn2+ (0.001M) $$\to$$ Cu2+ (0.01M) + Sn(s)

The Gibbs free energy change for the above reaction at 298 K is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$1 kJ mol$$-$$1. The value of x is __________. [nearest integer]

[Given : $$E_{C{u^{2 + }}/Cu}^\Theta  = 0.34\,V$$ ; $$E_{S{n^{2 + }}/Sn}^\Theta  =  - 0.14\,V$$ ; F = 96500 C mol$$-$$1]

[Given : $$E_{C{u^{2 + }}/Cu}^\Theta  = 0.34\,V$$ ; $$E_{S{n^{2 + }}/Sn}^\Theta  =  - 0.14\,V$$ ; F = 96500 C mol^{$$-$$1}]

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : If we move from poles to equator, the direction of acceleration due to gravity of earth always points towards the center of earth without any variation in its magnitude.

Reason R : At equator, the direction of acceleration due to the gravity is towards the center of earth.

In the light of above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
options.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
options.C: A is true but R is false.
options.D: A is false but R is true.

questions.question_text: A ball is projected vertically upward with an initial velocity of 50 ms$$-$$1 at t = 0s. At t = 2s, another ball is projected vertically upward with same velocity. At t = __________ s, second ball will meet the first ball (g = 10 ms$$-$$2).
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A ball is projected vertically upward with an initial velocity of 50 ms^{$$-$$1} at t = 0s. At t = 2s, another ball is projected vertically upward with same velocity. At t = __________ s, second ball will meet the first ball (g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2}).

questions.question_text: A batsman hits back a ball of mass 0.4 kg straight in the direction of the bowler without changing its initial speed of 15 ms$$-$$1. The impulse imparted to the ball is ___________ Ns.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A batsman hits back a ball of mass 0.4 kg straight in the direction of the bowler without changing its initial speed of 15 ms^{$$-$$1}. The impulse imparted to the ball is ___________ Ns.

questions.question_text: A system to 10 balls each of mass 2 kg are connected via massless and unstretchable string. The system is allowed to slip over the edge of a smooth table as shown in figure. Tension on the string between the 7th and 8th ball is __________ N when 6th ball just leaves the table.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A system to 10 balls each of mass 2 kg are connected via massless and unstretchable string. The system is allowed to slip over the edge of a smooth table as shown in figure. Tension on the string between the 7^{th} and 8^{th} ball is __________ N when 6^{th} ball just leaves the table.

questions.question_text:
A geyser heats water flowing at a rate of 2.0 kg per minute from 30$$^\circ$$C to 70$$^\circ$$C. If geyser operates on a gas burner, the rate of combustion of fuel will be ___________ g min$$-$$1.

[Heat of combustion = 8 $$\times$$ 103 Jg$$-$$1, Specific heat of water = 4.2 Jg$$-$$1 $$^\circ$$C$$-$$1]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A geyser heats water flowing at a rate of 2.0 kg per minute from 30$$^\circ$$C to 70$$^\circ$$C. If geyser operates on a gas burner, the rate of combustion of fuel will be ___________ g min^{$$-$$1}. 
[Heat of combustion = 8 $$\times$$ 10^{3} Jg^{$$-$$1}, Specific heat of water = 4.2 Jg^{$$-$$1} $$^\circ$$C^{$$-$$1}]

questions.question_text: A set of 20 tuning forks is arranged in a series of increasing frequencies. If each fork gives 4 beats with respect to the preceding fork and the frequency of the last fork is twice the frequency of the first, then the frequency of last fork is _________ Hz.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A set of 20 tuning forks is arranged in a series of increasing frequencies. If each fork gives 4 beats with respect to the preceding fork and the frequency of the last fork is twice the frequency of the first, then the frequency of last fork is _________ Hz.

questions.question_text: Two 10 cm long, straight wires, each carrying a current of 5A are kept parallel to each other. If each wire experienced a force of 10$$-$$5 N, then separation between the wires is ____________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two 10 cm long, straight wires, each carrying a current of 5A are kept parallel to each other. If each wire experienced a force of 10^{$$-$$5} N, then separation between the wires is ____________ cm.

questions.question_text: A small bulb is placed at the bottom of a tank containing water to a depth of $$\sqrt7$$ m. The refractive index of water is $${4 \over 3}$$. The area of the surface of water through which light from the bulb can emerge out is x$$\pi$$ m2. The value of x is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A small bulb is placed at the bottom of a tank containing water to a depth of $$\sqrt7$$ m. The refractive index of water is $${4 \over 3}$$. The area of the surface of water through which light from the bulb can emerge out is x$$\pi$$ m^{2}. The value of x is __________.

questions.question_text: A travelling microscope is used to determine the refractive index of a glass slab. If 40 divisions are there in 1 cm on main scale and 50 Vernier scale divisions are equal to 49 main scale divisions, then least count of the travelling microscope is __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$6 m.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A travelling microscope is used to determine the refractive index of a glass slab. If 40 divisions are there in 1 cm on main scale and 50 Vernier scale divisions are equal to 49 main scale divisions, then least count of the travelling microscope is __________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$6} m.

questions.question_text:
The stopping potential for photoelectrons emitted from a surface illuminated by light of wavelength 6630 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ is 0.42 V. If the threshold frequency is x $$\times$$ 1013 /s, where x is _________ (nearest integer).

(Given, speed light = 3 $$\times$$ 108 m/s, Planck's constant = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
The stopping potential for photoelectrons emitted from a surface illuminated by light of wavelength 6630 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ is 0.42 V. If the threshold frequency is x $$\times$$ 10^{13} /s, where x is _________ (nearest integer). 
(Given, speed light = 3 $$\times$$ 10^{8} m/s, Planck's constant = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$34} Js)
